Title: A Rare Ashley Olsen Sighting Provides a Lesson in Ultimate High-Low Dressing
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: Products are independently selected by our editors. We may earn an affiliate commission from links. Hark, the first glimpse of an Olsen in 2025! It’s Ashley Olsen, Olsening in a way only she and Mary-Kate can. (Despite the copycats and The Row flatterees.) Photographed out in New York City, The Row founder was seen running errands in a long-line black puffer jacket, a gnome-like black beanie (both she and her sister are fans of tall headgear), a checked scarf, and black track pants tucked into grey marl socks. On her feet, she wore Nike V2K Run Sneakers—a sporty, out-of-step footwear choice for Olsen, who often opts for a ballet flat or sleek Mary Jane from her own label, or a Birkenstock clog. On her arm, she toted her brand’s enduringly covetable Margaux bag—quite the contrast. But Ashley is a dab hand at high-low dressing and off-beat pairings: whether that’s a coat and flip-flop combo or twinning with her actual twin. While the stealth wealth emblem, the Margaux bag, has reached the upper echelons of desirability and virality, it’s also a pretty practical accessory for when you’re scooting about the city on a mission like Olsen. Then the Nike sneakers, with subtle detailing and a chunky, comfortable sole, makes more sense. Sneakers can be a tough pick—especially when your overall aesthetic leans more light and feminine. This week, Bella Hadid leaned into the ’80s Jane Fonda dance class aesthetic, pairing a tank top and polka dot bodycon shorts with distressed Coach sneakers. The Row’s Owen runner has become its own street style favorite over the years, and it doesn’t look like we’re getting over the Adidas Samba OG anytime soon, beloved by everyone from Emily Ratajkowski to Kendall Jenner. Puma’s Speedcats are picking up on the track, with Dua Lipa fronting its campaign. And if you so happened to be at Copenhagen Fashion Week, you’ll have spotted Cecilie Bahnsen’s romantic ASICS collabs on all the cool girls’ feet. (Be quick, a new, floral-studded drop is coming from Bahnsen x ASICS.) Both Olsen twins, too, are pros at dressing for the relentless cold: layering trenches and button-ups, expert layers, and knits. Even if a Margaux is a far-off dream, God knows we need Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen’s state of dressing pointers right now. Title: As Peggy Flanagan Runs for Senate, a Look Back At Her Intentional Style
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: Earlier this morning, Lieutenant Governor of Minnesota Peggy Flanagan formally announced that she will be running to represent the state in the U.S. Senate. “A Native American woman has never won a seat in the U.S. Senate before,” Flanagan wrote on her Instagram page. “I believe we can change that. Are you with me?” Flanagan is seeking to replace Senator Tina Smith, who announced earlier this month that she would not seek re-election in 2026, opening up a seat for Minnesota. A Democrat who has served as Minnesota’s Lieutenant Governor since 2018, Flanagan was heavily involved in last year's Harris-Walz campaign. Throughout the race, her intentional fashion choices were impossible to miss. At the 2024 DNC, Flanagan wore a black and white Jamie Okuma Parfleche blazer and skirt, and a pair of Copper Canoe Woman statement earrings. Flanagan has chosen to spotlight contemporary Indigenous designers on the national stage (Flanagan is a member of the White Earth Band of Ojibwe). “I really want those earrings,” one viewer noted, while another simply exclaimed, “She is fabulous!” Wearing Jamie Okuma In the months that followed, as the presidential election race continued to accelerate, Flanagan only continued this intentional approach to dressing for the campaign trail. Whether speaking at rallies or canvassing for citizens to get out and vote, Flanagan has been using what she wears for a much deeper purpose—to draw attention to some of the nation’s finest Indigenous designers, and on a larger level, to draw awareness to the Indigenous community as a whole. (Especially in certain swing states, such as Arizona, where the Indigenous vote was crucial.) Wearing a traditional ribbon skirt It’s no secret that what politicians wear in the public domain is always strategic. Whereas Kamala Harris and Dr. Jill Biden have both embraced patriotic style—keeping to classic shades of red, white, and blue to demonstrate their love for their country—Flanagan has chosen colorful garments, including traditional ribbon skirts, as well as statement earrings (her signature piece) made of dentalium shells, beads, or turquoise; She has taken a distinctive approach that champions the unique beauty and craftwork found within her own Native community. The celebratory and upbeat feel of her ensembles is also fitting given that, if Flanagan is elected to the Senate, she would become the first Native American woman to win a seat; What she has worn, then, has nodded to this potentially historic moment. Flanagan's themed earrings Flanagan isn’t the only politician to take such a thoughtful approach to fashion, either. Throughout their times in office, Secretary of the Interior Deb Haaland and Kansas Representative Sharice Davids have done so as well. For Haaland’s swearing-in ceremony back in 2021, she donned a vibrant traditional ribbon dress from Reecreations, moccasins, and dragonfly earrings made by the Laguna Pueblo metalsmith Pat Pruitt. For Flanagan, however, her joyful approach to style reflects how she is feeling in this very moment. “As the first Native American and woman of color elected statewide in Minnesota,” she wrote on Instagram, “I am overwhelmed with gratitude and hope.” This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. Title: Bella Hadid Is Keeping the ’80s Alive
Author: By Hannah Jackson
Content: Fashion may be obsessed with all things naughties at the moment, but Bella Hadid is all in on the 1980s. Yesterday in Los Angeles, the model left a photoshoot looking the picture of a jazzercise aficionado. She wore a sheer white tank top over a white bra and knee-length white shorts with black polka dots. The bodycon bottoms, from Miaou, were even affixed with a precious black bow. Rounding out her look was a pair of tall white socks scrunched around her calves and a pair of distressed Coach sneakers. Hadid opted for black accessories to complement the black micro polka dots in her shorts, trotting out her beloved Saint Laurent Y Bag and a pair of black sunglasses. While the look was plenty modern, we could easily imagine her starring in a series of exercise VHS tapes à la Jane Fonda, or appearing as a background actor in a remake of 1985’s Perfect. We feel confident that Bella Hadid could singlehandedly kickstart a jazzercise craze—or, at the very least, an ’80s-fashion moment. Title: Hailey Bieber Heralds the Return of This Divisive Shoe Trend
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: Hailey Bieber has returned to the West Coast after a mammoth stint away from home, packing away her enviable coat collection and sharp suiting that led her Aspen and New York wardrobes. For this Los Angeles homecoming and her latest Rhode pop-up, Bieber relied on some of her sartorial calling cards—adding a divisive vintage shoe trend. Bieber wore a fresh off the runway dress from the Ferragamo spring 2025 collection: an espresso brown leather mini-dress with sculptural details and a curved skirt, which she paired with a matching brown, croc leather pouch. On her feet, she wore strappy, laced sandals with an expansive peep-toe. The ’50s-era summer shoe is so back. The beauty founder stepped out party-ready at the launch of her latest product, the limited edition Sugar Cookie Peptide Lip Treatment. She posed with fans and friends at the pop-up, popping a sheer, chocolate brown tighted leg to show off the toe-exposing pumps. It was a chic way to wear the nostalgic—and much maligned—shoe silhouette. Following the event, Bieber was joined by her husband Justin—in his usual style of fits, comprising of baggy jeans, an even roomier leather jacket, and cap—and the pair were spotted heading for dinner at Funke with friends in Beverly Hills. Hailey added a faux fur coat. More ladylike shoe trends continue to emerge. Recent BAFTA winner Mikey Madison is a fan of Ferragamo’s patent t-bar sandal. The T-bar heel harks back to the ’40s and ’50s, a polite shoe silhouette worn often by Audrey Hepburn and repped also by everyone from Zoe Saldaña to Ariana Grande, in Jimmy Choo and Khaite respectively. The peep-toe’s comeback has been quiet yet assured, with some more modern updates: by way of Tory Burch’s sculpted peep-toe pumps with a crescent heel, Magda Butrym’s floral detail heels with a pearl just kissing the exposed toe, textured Alaïa slip-ons, and Dries Van Noten’s treble toe enveloping, piggie-baring mules. And with it still not being warm enough yet for bare legs and feet, a peep-toe paired with a sheer tight offers another teasing, sensual feeling layer a la Hailey Bieber. Title: 27 of Rihanna’s Boldest Style Moments Throughout the Years
Author: By Alice Cary
Content: As far as fashion is concerned, Rihanna has always been ahead of the curve—able to dabble in trends in a genuinely fearless manner. Risk-taking is central to her style influence, and what better time to revisit her epic wardrobe than today, on her 37th birthday? Off-duty, Rihanna is a true fashion girl. By day, she's in tracksuit-stiletto combos, gargantuan puffer jackets, and killer thigh-high boots. By night, she’s often wearing similarly casual gear, with the added touch of some vintage jewelry (or lots of diamonds) and a designer coat. Uniting her day-to-night dressing? A sense of fun and excitement: Don’t ever expect the star to wear discrete everyday basics. Rih’s red carpet looks command attention, too, though. In the noughties, she rocked low-rise trousers, crop tops, and plentiful diamanté. In 2015, she made headlines with a sunshine-yellow Guo Pei gown at the Met Gala, and her 2017 Comme des Garçons dress and 2018 John Galliano headpiece also broke the internet. More recently, she attended the Fashion Awards in London—with A$AP Rocky by her side—sporting a a Christian Lacroix fall 2002 couture mini dress with the matching oversized fuzzy hat, naturally. In honor of her birthday, revisit Rihanna’s most head-turning looks, below. Rih was one of the first out the gate in Saint Laurent’s fuzzy heart coat back in 2016, shown at the maison’s fall 2016 showcase. Many stars have braved the naked dress—Rihanna included. She commanded attention in a sparkling Swarovski crystal-encrusted look by Adam Selman at the CFDA Awards in 2014. Comme des Garçons was behind the eccentric look that she wore to the Met Gala in 2017. The vibrant gown that she wore to the Met Gala in 2015 will go down in history as one of the best looks the event has ever witnessed. Rihanna attended her Diamond Ball—a bash that she throws every year—wearing Alexis Mabille couture and Chopard jewels in 2018. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Saoirse Ronan Has Undergone a Style Shift for the Ages
Author: By Hannah Jackson
Content: Earlier this year, Saoirse Ronan returned to the screen with a doubleheader: Steve McQueen’s World War II film Blitz, and her passion project, The Outrun, a drama about a woman just out of rehab. For her reentry into the public eye, Ronan tapped stylist Danielle Goldberg to help her meet the moment. Lo, Ronan’s rejuvenated sense of style has already set the internet ablaze, like when she was spotted wearing a vibrant teal JW Anderson dress—and fresh off the runway, no less. But, much like her prolific acting career, she’s no one-hit wonder. She’s turned heads in refined, yet unconventional looks, like her power-clashing moment in archival Phoebe Philo-era Celine from 2013 and the eggshell Khaite dress worn over trousers for a conversation with her Ladybird and Little Women costar Timothée Chalamet at BFI Southbank. But fashion fiends have been particularly thrilled with Goldberg styling the Oscar nominee in younger labels like newly minted LVMH Prize winner Hodakova, New York darling Colleen Allen, and ultra-cool sunglasses brand Thistles. We got an early taste of what we can expect from Ronan’s red carpet style at the 2024 Gotham Awards in New York City where the actor shot straight to best-dressed territory in an ankle-length Schiaparelli couture dress embellished with 3D thorns and complete with a rosette emerging from the neckline of her bustier. But she’s also gone the more classic route, like at the British Independent Film Awards, where she wore a sparkly dark blue caped dress—a custom Erdem. A regular collaborator with Nicolas Ghesquière, she turned to Louis Vuitton for the 2024 Emmys, where she wore a navy blue two-piece with a sheer draped panel, and again for the Academy Museum Gala where she opted for a black column dress with a sculptural off-the-shoulder top. The pair also kicked off the season on a high at the Governors Awards, where Ronan wore a light aqua Louis Vuitton column dress with a tactile bodice. Ghesquière also dressed the actor for the back-to-back IFTA and BAFTA Awards. For the former, Ronan wore a billowing strapless dress in that same beguiling blue as her JW Anderson mini; and at the BAFTAs, she wore a more subdued seafoam green scoop-neck with a matching stole. Follow along here as we celebrate Saoirse Ronan’s style throughout the 2024-2025 awards season. Title: Need Office Style Inspiration? Do Yourself a Favor and Watch Clockwatchers
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: For those of us navigating the corporate world, getting dressed in a smart and professional look every day for work can be—well—a challenge. An endless calendar of deadlines and meetings means that you need a rotating wardrobe of smart shirts and sleek blazers to go with them. It can also be hard to have fun and add flavor into your work style, especially if you’re in a more traditional office setting. Investment banking in cool ripped jeans and a mesh JPG top? Unlikely. However. . . have you watched the underrated 1997 dark comedy Clockwatchers recently? If not, do it for the style inspiration alone: A recent re-watch of the workplace comedy has unearthed a goldmine of corporate style ideas worth taking notes on. If you have yet to see this often-overlooked film, let’s get the plot out of the way. Directed by Jill Sprecher and costume designed by Edi Giguere, the movie follows a group of Global Credit temporary employees as they navigate their unfulfilling day-to-day duties in the office. The real star of the show, though, is not the satiric script or the campy performances, but rather how each character brings their own unique approach to dressing for the corporate ladder. There’s Iris (Toni Collette), the new girl with a prim-and-proper sensibility, thanks to her buttoned-up cardigans and skirts; Margaret (Parker Posey), the edgy and jaded temp who stomps around in her cool chunky sweaters and grungy combat boots; Paula (Lisa Kudrow), an aspiring actor whose silky blouses and mini skirts lean into office siren territory; And Jane (Alanna Ubach), who dresses more ladylike in her classic shift dresses and statement jewelry. Talk about a star-studded cast—and their chic ensembles are just as noteworthy. Throughout the film, the four office friends slowly begin to descend into madness—the humdrum environment and corporate watchdogs causing them to grow more paranoid and unhappy by the day. But even as their polished facades come undone in the workplace, and their office goes dystopian and Orwellian real quick, their impeccable style persists. We first meet Paula, for instance, at the copy machine in a chic Gucci statement belt. Even near the end of the film, despite all of the grim happenings around them, her love for a good silky top and pristine blowout continues to steal all the scenes. The four characters each show how to bring personality to office looks. Margaret, for one, pairs a burgundy corduroy skirt suit with tights and chunky boots one day, and a teal V-neck sweater with a punky plaid skirt another; the perfect balances of dressy and cool. Paul and Jane each take turns wearing bold, bright-colored summer dresses that are a statement, yet still suitable for the boardroom. Watching the movie again has totally inspired me to rethink my approach to office dressing. The next time you’re doubting if your cool, trendy outfit is work-ready, just channel the Clockwatchers girls and remember: You can embrace fashion and individuality without being sent to Human Resources. Title: Polka Dots Are Trending—18 Ways to Wear the Runway-Loved Print
Author: By Cortne Bonilla
Content: Products are independently selected by our editors. We may earn an affiliate commission from links. For most fashion aficionados, stripes are neutral at this point. The print—whether horizontal or vertical, colorful or subdued—easily complements trending hues and patterns. For spring and summer, they tend to become the hero of the season, but this year another pattern is vying for your attention. Polka dots! Polka dot-printed clothing is about as classic as it gets, but we’ve seen a resurgence of the timeless pattern stamped onto new season silhouettes. It popped up during the spring/summer 2025 shows, making waves at Jacquemus and Acne Studios, and proved its staying power by re-emerging yet again on the fall/winter 2025 runways. Think of Altuzarra’s fall 2025 ready-to-wear collection, where dotted billowy coats, halterneck dresses, and knitwear were given a cool, laid-back kind of femininity. Brandon Maxwell showcased an artistic interpretation of the print with a brushed, drawn polka-dotted scarf coat. When it comes to styling your own polka-dot looks, you can never go wrong with traditional white and black. Jacquemus spring/summer 2025 For fresh color combinations, look to warm-weather-ready finds from Posse’s red-and-pink dotted sundress to Bode’s chocolate brown print. If you fancy the feminine—a flouncy tie-neck blouse and pleated skirt are ideal for the office, and a post-work date. If you’d prefer to go the casual route, wear a dotted button-up shirt with wide-leg linen trousers, then add a minimal sandal. Ahead, shop polka-dotted blouses, dresses, and skirts, for the emerging season. It’s been seasons of minimalist shirt trends but now is the time, when print clashing and vintage-inspired patterns are trending, to test out the polka dot blouse. Consider a ruffled gown from Rixo, which would look so chic teamed with a modern wedge, or, go the demure route with Zimmerman's sweet V-neck midi. How? Well, pair Mango’s silky option with a crisp white poplin blouse and knee-high boots. Or, wear Altuzarra’s Kinski maxi skirt with leather mules and an oversized sweater. Toss a trench coat over both. Title: Keke Palmer Shakes Up a Classic White Shirtdress
Author: By Hannah Jackson
Content: Fashion can be a very serious business, but Keke Palmer—the bona fide comedian she is—knows that, sometimes, an outfit just needs a healthy dose of humor. Last night, at the 7th Annual American Black Film Festival Honors in Los Angeles, the actor brought some levity to a time-honored wardrobe staple: the white shirtdress. Styled by Zoe Costello, Palmer wore an off-the-shoulder Balmain number from Olivier Rousteing’s resort 2025 collection. Sexier than a de rigueur shirtdress, it featured a thigh-high slit and a cinched waist. Best of all, the trompe l’oeil number was complete with a stiff white collar—and a tag—over her décolletage, as if she was holding the dress in front of her. Palmer took the outfit in a different direction than the Balmain collection’s lookbook. She wore a pair of black pointy-toe pumps and added a gold bee brooch to the dress’s vestigial collar. Keke Palmer at the 7th Annual American Black Film Festival Honors. Balmain resort 2025. The actor has been all about bold fashion lately. On her recent press tour for her film One of Them Days, she broke out some serious vintage looks, including a cerulean John Galliano Dior dress from 2007, and a burnt orange Dolce & Gabbana from the same year. And that’s nothing to say of her contemporary looks. With some surreal Schiaparelli under her belt, it’s no wonder Keke Palmer embraced this funky Balmain shirtdress. Title: How To Get Rid Of Clothes Moths And Protect Your Wardrobe
Author: By Ellie Pithers
Content: Products are independently selected by our editors. We may earn an affiliate commission from links. Moth-proofing your wardrobe is essential, if you don’t want the insects feeding on your most expensive cashmere knits and silk dresses. Clothes moths kill your investment pieces, and completely negates that big closet clean-out you did. While moth season tends to run from April to May, and then again from August to September, it’s become an issue throughout the U.S., thanks to rising temperatures. Not sure where to begin? Below, see Vogue’s top tips for preventing a moth infestation in your wardrobe—and how to tackle one if it’s already too late. Moths tend to be attracted to natural fibers like cashmere, silk, lambswool, shearling, and cotton because they feed on the protein keratin, the building block of these materials. Given that keratin also helps form human hair, skin, and nails, it’s crucial that you ensure your clothes are clean before you stow them away in your wardrobe. If you see a moth flying around your home, don’t fear. It’s not necessarily a clothes moth. The two main types that feed on your clothes in the United States—the webbing clothes moth (Tineola bisselliella) and the casemaking clothes moth (Tinea pellionella)—are small and difficult to see. The webbing clothes moth is identifiable from its golden color and around half an inch in length, while the casemaking clothes moth is pale, silvery gray-brown with dark spots, and fringed, hairy wings. Most people realize clothes moths have invaded their wardrobes when they see small holes in their knitwear or silk dresses. One option is to keep Pheromone super sticky glue traps, which attract the male moths, therefore removing them from the reproduction cycle, in your wardrobe or around your home. They also act as an indicator as to whether you have moths, or you can also use a moth box to monitor for a possible infestation. Moths eggs are tiny—usually between 0.5 to 1.5 millimeters in size—making them extremely difficult to see, but you might spot the webbing that larvae leave behind on your clothes. The life cycle of a moth is 65 to 90 days, with female moths laying up to 300 eggs each. This means your small moth problem can very quickly escalate. It’s the larvae that feast on natural fibers, not the adult moths which don’t actually have the ability to eat. Eggs will hatch after anything between four days and three weeks—in summer this process is faster than in winter. Yes—however it requires real commitment and dedication (and sometimes professional help) to get on top of an infestation. Once you have managed to do so, the key is to keep following the below steps to safeguard your wardrobe against clothes moths and prevent further infestations from happening again and again. Moths can enter your home through cracks, windows, and on new items of clothing, so just because you have got on top of your problem doesn’t mean they won’t return. Moths like undisturbed corners that are dark and warm. Remove everything from your wardrobe, vacuum all the corners and drawers, and wipe all your surfaces with a detergent-soaked cloth to kill off larvae. Then wash all of your clothes (and curtains and upholstery, too). Dry cleaning kills moth eggs and larvae, and is an excellent option for bulky items like coats. Freeze anything you can fit on your freezer shelves; sub-zero temperatures kill larvae, although make sure you put clothes in plastic bags prior to freezing to avoid a condensation build-up. Keep them in there for at least 48 hours, or up to a week if you can. Heat also kills larvae and eggs, however, hot temperatures can damage cashmere. To ensure you’ve got rid of all the larvae and eggs, Total Wardrobe Care’s Julia Dee explains that you can start by “applying natural moth-killing products, such as chrysanthemum-based sprays.” This will prevent any more moths hatching, so you don’t go back to square one. A moth infestation can cause thousands of pounds worth of damage depending on the clothes you have in your wardrobe, and so bringing in the professionals to fumigate your house if the problem is significant is often worth the investment. Moths love to feast on human sweat, food particles, and stains. Do not put any clothes back in your newly cleaned wardrobe that are dirty—especially knitwear or natural fibers. As well as laundering your clothes, ensure that your wardrobe and drawers are also clean. “Regularly wipe down surfaces with soapy water and thoroughly vacuum cracks and crevices to remove any larvae or eggs,” Dee recommends. Moths hate light and movement, so this can also help disturb them. Always store winter knits, coats, and any other items you particularly value in zipped garment bags (like knitwear and cashmere bags), and line the bags with anti-moth paper strips. Line your drawers in anti-moth paper, and deploy cedarwood blocks. Vintage clothes should always be dry cleaned or put in the freezer before being introduced to your wardrobe, as they are often the source of infestations. Moths hate them, and they’ll keep the shoulders on your dresses and jackets neat, too. Always take your clothes out of the plastic hanging bags from the dry cleaner. The plastic attracts dust, and the dust attracts moths. Keep checking your clothes for moth holes, keep rooms well-ventilated as temperatures start to rise, and keep a natural oil diffuser in your wardrobe at all times—it smells great and wards off moths. Moth cassettes are also a good precautionary measure, and you can keep them hanging on your rail at all times. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Rising Star David Jonsson Is More Than Ready For His Rat Pack Moment
Author: By Kerry McDermott
Content: “I’m an introvert by nature,” David Jonsson tells Vogue, days before attending the 2025 BAFTAs, where he was in the running for the Rising Star prize (spoiler alert: he won!). While walking the red carpet doesn’t necessarily come naturally to the Rye Lane star, “it’s made 10 times easier when you look good,” he says with a smile. To that end, the 31-year-old has chosen a custom Gucci tux with a Swarovski embroidered vest and a satin bow tie for the biggest night in British film—which earned him a major milestone in his own career (previous Rising Star winners include Tom Hardy, John Boyega, Daniel Kaluuya and Tom Holland). “I remember the kids growing up in my area in east London, you know, people would go to desperate lengths to wear Gucci. It really feels special.” He’s accessorized with the help of “another dream brand,” Cartier, which supplied David’s rare Cloche de Cartier timepiece. “It’s in the shape of a D, funnily enough,” he says, listing watches as one of his guilty pleasures, along with cars and motorcycles. (“I sound like such a boy.”) “For me, part of fashion is functionality,” says Jonsson, who is currently preparing to play Sammy Davis Jr to Sydney Sweeney’s Kim Novak in Colman Domingo’s directorial debut, Scandalous. “You can use it to your favor: to exude confidence or exude sexiness or exude class, or whatever. If I don’t feel confident in something, I’d rather go nude!” Growing up, he says, that meant throwing on a graphic tee, or “whatever you feel good in,” but the actor increasingly finds himself drawn to tailoring. “I’ve been looking a lot at Sammy Davis Jr and the Rat Pack. Those men…They knew how to dress up.” Jonsson no doubt has plenty of awards ceremonies in his future, and he’s learning to embrace the process of getting ready for a red carpet. “I learn a lot from actors that I adore, and I remember Cillian Murphy saying, you’d be an [idiot] not to enjoy these moments,” he says. “I love the rituals of getting ready… a nice shower, and I’m a big fan of scents as well. Those are the moments I like taking some time over. When you get to wear stuff like what I’m wearing to the BAFTAs, you should take your time, you know? Enjoy it.” More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Dakota Johnson Puts Her Own Twist on the Safety Pin Dress With a Sexy Slit
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: It’s been a while since we’ve had a show-stopping dress slit. Purveyors of the classic and sexy red carpet look range from Angelina Jolie to Miley Cyrus—another lover of the leggy affair? Dakota Johnson. And this time, the actor went from thigh-high to hip-kissing. Johnson stepped out on the red carpet for Saturday Night Live’s 50th anniversary special at 30 Rockerfeller Center on Sunday evening (February 16)—a starry event celebrating the pop culture behemoth, with attendees including Vogue cover star Sabrina Carpenter, Kim Kardashian, Miley Cyrus, Emma Stone, and Bad Bunny. The Madame Web actor wore a black, one-sleeved Gucci gown fastened with delicate gold hardware and a bodysuit underneath, allowing the brave slit to travel up to her hips. She also wore black open-toed stilettos and minimal jewelry, with a sweep of eyebrow-skimming bangs and her brunette hair long and straight. The delicate gold chains holding Johnson’s Gucci dress together recalled another sensual and daring red carpet look: the safety pin dress, which through the years, has been worn by Anne Hathaway, Miley Cyrus, Kristen Stewart, and of course the vivacious original, Elizabeth Hurley in Versace. Johnson’s own interpretation is stoically sensual. It was a stylish weekend of events celebrating Saturday Night Live’ 50th year, that ran the gamut of true Hollywood glam and campy looks. Emma Stone filled her custom Louis Vuitton gown pockets with popcorn and toted a cinema snack box in lieu of a bag, while Miley Cyrus donned two Roberto Cavalli looks—one recent runway, one archival—for a gothic showgirl performance. For her own stage-time to do the ever-iconic “D*ck in a Box” song, Lady Gaga wore a black velvet gown with a zany-patterned gift box attached to her waist. Glamor, intrigue, sex—a stellar sartorial tribute to SNL. Johnson is no stranger to skin-forward gowns, and it’s usually Gucci that’s her go-to: sheer, silvered, shimmering. But what Dakota Johnson surely proves here is that sometimes, your legs are your best accessory. Jennifer Lawrence Adds Dad Shoes to Her Maternity Wardrobe Why Does Everyone Have a Belted Bag Now? Title: Emma Stone Takes the ‘Popcorn Actress’ Label Literally
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: One of those best things about going out to see a show? The theater snacks. Maybe a box of nachos or a little cup of ice-cream to see you through the evening—but Emma Stone is all about the popcorn. And she made sure she had enough to hand at SNL50: The Anniversary Special in New York City, by wearing her own cinema snacks on her hips. The actor stepped onto the red carpet with partner and former SNL writer Dave McCary sporting a custom Louis Vuitton, cinema seat red, halterneck dress. The dress had two pockets that were heaping with popcorn. The rest of Stone’s look was simple: Louis Vuitton red heels, gold star-shaped earrings, and in lieu of a bag, a candy-striped popcorn box filled with more popcorn that she of course helped herself to. Stone wore her hair in her latest pixie cut. This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. It was also a special sort of date night for Stone and McCary ,who first met in 2016, when Stone, who hosted SNL in December that same year, starred in a sketch directed by McCary, “Wells for Boys.” Stone is also one of only a few five-time SNL hosts (and remains the youngest to have ever done so) including Steve Martin and Tom Hanks. It’s also not the first time popcorn has been part of the 2025 entertainment industry chatter. Rewind, to Demi Moore’s speech at the 2025 Golden Globes ,when she won best actress for The Substance. It marked the first major industry award in the 62-year-old actor’s 45-year career, and in her moving acceptance speech, she acknowledged the stereotypes she has faced for having starred in films primed for entertainment value and box-office earnings over critical reception or contributions to cinema discourse—defying the ‘popcorn actress’ label. And as the weekend of SNL celebrations continued and we reflected on the mammoth show’s impact on pop culture, the moniker feels even more foolish. Stone’s snackable style was by longtime stylist Petra Flannery, whose other client Zoe Saldaña took home best supporting actress for Emilia Perez at the BAFTAs on the same evening. Less campy than Stone but still big on the drama, Zoe Saldaña wore a pleated collar Yves Saint Laurent gown. We could maybe just about get away with likening Stone’s popcorn-filled pockets to the structured hips and peplum silhouetted gowns that are more in keeping with her usual red carpet style: like her eggshell colored 2024 Oscars gown, or her red shelf-hipped 2025 Golden Globes dress—both also by Louis Vuitton. Popcorn pockets or whimsy peplums, Stone tends to lean into classic Hollywood glamor and elegant gowns. Her last red carpet surprise was all about her newly done pixie cut—which she’s likely cut for Bugonia, her latest film with Yorgos Lanthimos and which is set to debut in 2025. Stone’s SNL50 dress went down well with fellow attendees—Seth Rogan even got a couple of handfuls. Feeling peckish? Emma Stone’s got you. But one question that remains: was it sweet or salted, buttered or toffee? More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Blake Lively Brings Her Love of Florals to SNL’s 50th Anniversary Special
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: Tonight, the Saturday Night Live 50th Anniversary Special airs on NBC—celebrating five decades of the hit sketch comedy show, with a slew of celebrity guest cameos. The red carpet premiere in New York City was extremely star studded: Kim Kardashian, Bad Bunny, Meryl Streep, Anya Taylor-Joy, and more all hit the step and repeat. One high-profile duo in the mix? Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds, who attended the occasion in their finest formal attire. Lively opted for her signature red carpet look for the night: a glitzy floral-covered dress. (Fans of the star will recall she wore floral designs nonstop throughout her It Ends With Us press tour, as a nod to her character in the film, who is a florist.) Lively’s latest SNL look consisted of a silver Tamara Ralph sequin-covered gown, complete with floral embellishments throughout. For a more monochromatic finish, she accessorized with diamonds and strappy metallic hells. Reynolds, meanwhile, wore a classic black tuxedo, white dress shirt, and a bowtie. Tonight marked one of Lively’s first major public appearances since reports of a legal battle between her and her It Ends With Us co-star Justin Baldoni emerged—a dispute which remains ongoing. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Inside the Stylish Weekend Celebrating Saturday Night Live’s 50th Anniversary
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: Saturday Night Live is marking a major milestone: This weekend, the iconic sketch comedy show from creator Lorne Michaels is celebrating its 50th anniversary with a slew of events in New York City. The festivities kicked off on Friday evening, with the SNL50: The Homecoming Concert at Radio City Music Hall. Naturally, the red carpet was a star-studded affair. Given SNL has welcomed hundreds of A-list hosts and musical guests over the years (it’s hard to think of a big star who hasn’t made a cameo on the show), it was only fitting that many celebrities joined the fun. Among those who walked the step and repeat on Friday were Miley Cyrus, Chris Pine, Christine Baranski—each one of them bringing some good, old-fashioned glitz and glamour to the party. Inside the historic venue, Lady Gaga performed “Shallow” with Andy Samberg, and did a funny bit to botch the song, before performing “Dick in a Box”—their 2009 SNL parody banger. Gaga, in a velvet black dress, stood with a zany giftbox taped to her waist—three guesses as to what they’re insinuating is inside. Miley Cyrus took to the stage in her gothic showgirl glory to perform “Flowers”, do a cover of Queen’s “Crazy Little Thing Called Love” with Brittany Howard, and shout that she loves Paul Rudd. Cher also performed “If I Could Turn Back Time,” well as Bad Bunny, Post Malone, The Backstreet Boys, The B-52’s, and Will Ferrell and Ana Gasteyer (who did their own hilarious versions of songs like Doechii’s “Denial is a River.” The celebrations continued on Sunday night, with the official SNL50: The Anniversary Special airing on NBC. Another step and repeat premiere was held for the release—and even more celebrities came out for the viewing party. Below, see all of the stars at SNL’s 50th-anniversary kickoff and how things went down inside. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: The Best Dressed Stars From the 2025 BAFTAs
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: This evening in London, the 2025 BAFTAs marked the latest celebration of some of the last year’s best film and television projects—among them Wicked, Emilia Pérez, Anora, and Conclave. As such, the red carpet saw a bevy of A-list stars turn out for the affair (many of whom are also nominated for Academy Awards in March). The best dressed stars of the night? Those who leaned into New Hollywood glamour (yes, you read that right), choosing sculptural silhouettes and modernized finishes that felt fresh. Take Wicked star Cynthia Erivo, who went ethereal in her white macramé cotton lace bustier gown (with a breastplate that defied gravity—get it?). In McQueen, Demi Moore also turned heads in a dazzling gown that was reminiscent of stained glass, while Emilia Pérez star Selena Gomez chose a long, sleeveless gown by Schiaparelli Couture embroidered with silver sequins, crystals, rhinestones, and tassels—talk about disco ball dressing at its finest. As for some of the best dressed gents of the night? Colman Domingo reworked traditional suiting in a printed shirt and leather coat by Versace. Timothée Chalamet went sleek in all black Bottega Veneta—a refreshing switch-up from the bolder, more Y2K-leaning looks he has been wearing while promoting A Complete Unknown. (And isn’t that the making of a true fashion star—keeping us on our toes?) Below, see the best dressed stars from the 2025 BAFTAs. Is this your favorite look? Is this your favorite look? Is this your favorite look? Is this your favorite look? Is this your favorite look? More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Timothée Chalamet and Kylie Jenner Do Matching Couple Style at the BAFTAs
Author: By Olivia Allen
Content: With the 2025 BAFTAs in full swing, Timothée Chalamet has once again got us talking. Fresh off the A Complete Unknown press tour–zipping around on a Lime bike in Martine Rose and fully leaning into his Bob Dylan era—his latest look continues the streak. Over the weekend, he made waves at the Berlin Film Festival, out in Kendrick-inspired bootcut jeans and accompanying Kylie Jenner in a pink Chrome Hearts tracksuit—a stark contrast against his girlfriend’s glittering gown. For tonight’s red carpet, though, Timmy went for something a bit more classic. The best-actor nominee wore a double-breasted, all-black ensemble by Bottega Veneta—proving that sometimes simplicity really is best. It was a departure from his laidback athleisure looks this week, but felt like exactly the right choice for his moment in the limelight. While Jenner skipped the step and repeat (as she did at the Golden Globes and in Berlin), the beauty mogul was spotted inside the ceremony wearing a black embellished slip dress—perfectly matching Timothée’s sleek red carpet look. Title: Cynthia Erivo’s Louis Vuitton Breastplate Defies Gravity at the 2025 BAFTAs
Author: By Olivia Allen
Content: Cynthia Erivo knows how to make an entrance, and she did just that at the 2025 BAFTAs tonight. In a white lace-embroidered Louis Vuitton gown, the Wicked star delivered a sculptural look that solidified her reputation for bold, red-carpet winning fashion. With its sharp architectural design, the dress was a statement that held space (get it?) from head to toe. While Erivo delivered a series of Elphaba-green looks during the Wicked press tour, the British actor has shifted towards a more monochrome colour palette during awards season—from the black-and-white floral gown she wore at the Golden Globes (also by Louis Vuitton) to the black sequined Armani Privè gown she wore at the Critics Choice Awards. Nominated for Best Actress at this year’s BAFTAs, Erivo’s transition from Broadway to film has been the stuff of legends—with three Oscars nominations under her belt, she’s solidified her place among Hollywood’s elite. As she gears up to co-host Vogue’s Fashion & Film party, it’s clear that Erivo is an unstoppable force both on screen and off. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Ayo Edebiri Wore New York Fashion Week’s Rising Star for SNL 50
Author: By Hannah Jackson
Content: It’s no secret that Ayo Edebiri quickly ascended to one of Hollywood’s best dressers in almost no time. While the actor has courted brands from Loewe to Prada, she’s always down to push the envelope with more avant-garde labels—with a helping hand from her stylist, Danielle Goldberg. Now, she’s the first to wear a brand-new piece from one of New York Fashion Week’s fast-rising stars, Colleen Allen. Edebiri was among the dozens of stars who participated in SNL’s 50th anniversary special over the weekend. The actor, who hosted the show in February 20204 returned to the hallowed halls of 30 Rock, joining Robert DeNiro, Drew Barrymore, Jimmy Fallon, and Rachel Dratch in a reprisal of “Debbie Downer.” Ayo Edebiri Colleen Allen fall 2025, look 2. The sketch was a black-tie affair, and Edebiri tapped Allen for the occasion, choosing a piece from the designer’s fall 2025 collection: a floor-length black velvet dress featuring a plunging, smocked neckline, which Edebiri styled with a black Sophie Buhai choker with a silver pendant. The dress debuted at NYFW just last week in an appointment-only presentation that my colleague José Criales-Unzueta described as “New York’s hottest club.” While Ayo Edebiri may not have been among the fashion editors who oohed and ahhed over Allen’s sumptuous velvets and rich color palette in person, she reminded us at SNL that she’s always got her finger on the pulse. Title: How To Get Rid Of Clothes Moths And Protect Your Wardrobe
Author: By Ellie Pithers
Content: Products are independently selected by our editors. We may earn an affiliate commission from links. Moth-proofing your wardrobe is essential, if you don’t want the insects feeding on your most expensive cashmere knits and silk dresses. Clothes moths kill your investment pieces, and completely negates that big closet clean-out you did. While moth season tends to run from April to May, and then again from August to September, it’s become an issue throughout the U.S., thanks to rising temperatures. Not sure where to begin? Below, see Vogue’s top tips for preventing a moth infestation in your wardrobe—and how to tackle one if it’s already too late. Moths tend to be attracted to natural fibers like cashmere, silk, lambswool, shearling, and cotton because they feed on the protein keratin, the building block of these materials. Given that keratin also helps form human hair, skin, and nails, it’s crucial that you ensure your clothes are clean before you stow them away in your wardrobe. If you see a moth flying around your home, don’t fear. It’s not necessarily a clothes moth. The two main types that feed on your clothes in the United States—the webbing clothes moth (Tineola bisselliella) and the casemaking clothes moth (Tinea pellionella)—are small and difficult to see. The webbing clothes moth is identifiable from its golden color and around half an inch in length, while the casemaking clothes moth is pale, silvery gray-brown with dark spots, and fringed, hairy wings. Most people realize clothes moths have invaded their wardrobes when they see small holes in their knitwear or silk dresses. One option is to keep Pheromone super sticky glue traps, which attract the male moths, therefore removing them from the reproduction cycle, in your wardrobe or around your home. They also act as an indicator as to whether you have moths, or you can also use a moth box to monitor for a possible infestation. Moths eggs are tiny—usually between 0.5 to 1.5 millimeters in size—making them extremely difficult to see, but you might spot the webbing that larvae leave behind on your clothes. The life cycle of a moth is 65 to 90 days, with female moths laying up to 300 eggs each. This means your small moth problem can very quickly escalate. It’s the larvae that feast on natural fibers, not the adult moths which don’t actually have the ability to eat. Eggs will hatch after anything between four days and three weeks—in summer this process is faster than in winter. Yes—however it requires real commitment and dedication (and sometimes professional help) to get on top of an infestation. Once you have managed to do so, the key is to keep following the below steps to safeguard your wardrobe against clothes moths and prevent further infestations from happening again and again. Moths can enter your home through cracks, windows, and on new items of clothing, so just because you have got on top of your problem doesn’t mean they won’t return. Moths like undisturbed corners that are dark and warm. Remove everything from your wardrobe, vacuum all the corners and drawers, and wipe all your surfaces with a detergent-soaked cloth to kill off larvae. Then wash all of your clothes (and curtains and upholstery, too). Dry cleaning kills moth eggs and larvae, and is an excellent option for bulky items like coats. Freeze anything you can fit on your freezer shelves; sub-zero temperatures kill larvae, although make sure you put clothes in plastic bags prior to freezing to avoid a condensation build-up. Keep them in there for at least 48 hours, or up to a week if you can. Heat also kills larvae and eggs, however, hot temperatures can damage cashmere. To ensure you’ve got rid of all the larvae and eggs, Total Wardrobe Care’s Julia Dee explains that you can start by “applying natural moth-killing products, such as chrysanthemum-based sprays.” This will prevent any more moths hatching, so you don’t go back to square one. A moth infestation can cause thousands of pounds worth of damage depending on the clothes you have in your wardrobe, and so bringing in the professionals to fumigate your house if the problem is significant is often worth the investment. Moths love to feast on human sweat, food particles, and stains. Do not put any clothes back in your newly cleaned wardrobe that are dirty—especially knitwear or natural fibers. As well as laundering your clothes, ensure that your wardrobe and drawers are also clean. “Regularly wipe down surfaces with soapy water and thoroughly vacuum cracks and crevices to remove any larvae or eggs,” Dee recommends. Moths hate light and movement, so this can also help disturb them. Always store winter knits, coats, and any other items you particularly value in zipped garment bags (like knitwear and cashmere bags), and line the bags with anti-moth paper strips. Line your drawers in anti-moth paper, and deploy cedarwood blocks. Vintage clothes should always be dry cleaned or put in the freezer before being introduced to your wardrobe, as they are often the source of infestations. Moths hate them, and they’ll keep the shoulders on your dresses and jackets neat, too. Always take your clothes out of the plastic hanging bags from the dry cleaner. The plastic attracts dust, and the dust attracts moths. Keep checking your clothes for moth holes, keep rooms well-ventilated as temperatures start to rise, and keep a natural oil diffuser in your wardrobe at all times—it smells great and wards off moths. Moth cassettes are also a good precautionary measure, and you can keep them hanging on your rail at all times. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Rising Star David Jonsson Is More Than Ready For His Rat Pack Moment
Author: By Kerry McDermott
Content: “I’m an introvert by nature,” David Jonsson tells Vogue, days before attending the 2025 BAFTAs, where he was in the running for the Rising Star prize (spoiler alert: he won!). While walking the red carpet doesn’t necessarily come naturally to the Rye Lane star, “it’s made 10 times easier when you look good,” he says with a smile. To that end, the 31-year-old has chosen a custom Gucci tux with a Swarovski embroidered vest and a satin bow tie for the biggest night in British film—which earned him a major milestone in his own career (previous Rising Star winners include Tom Hardy, John Boyega, Daniel Kaluuya and Tom Holland). “I remember the kids growing up in my area in east London, you know, people would go to desperate lengths to wear Gucci. It really feels special.” He’s accessorized with the help of “another dream brand,” Cartier, which supplied David’s rare Cloche de Cartier timepiece. “It’s in the shape of a D, funnily enough,” he says, listing watches as one of his guilty pleasures, along with cars and motorcycles. (“I sound like such a boy.”) “For me, part of fashion is functionality,” says Jonsson, who is currently preparing to play Sammy Davis Jr to Sydney Sweeney’s Kim Novak in Colman Domingo’s directorial debut, Scandalous. “You can use it to your favor: to exude confidence or exude sexiness or exude class, or whatever. If I don’t feel confident in something, I’d rather go nude!” Growing up, he says, that meant throwing on a graphic tee, or “whatever you feel good in,” but the actor increasingly finds himself drawn to tailoring. “I’ve been looking a lot at Sammy Davis Jr and the Rat Pack. Those men…They knew how to dress up.” Jonsson no doubt has plenty of awards ceremonies in his future, and he’s learning to embrace the process of getting ready for a red carpet. “I learn a lot from actors that I adore, and I remember Cillian Murphy saying, you’d be an [idiot] not to enjoy these moments,” he says. “I love the rituals of getting ready… a nice shower, and I’m a big fan of scents as well. Those are the moments I like taking some time over. When you get to wear stuff like what I’m wearing to the BAFTAs, you should take your time, you know? Enjoy it.” More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: The White Lotus Season 3 Fashion Is All About Loud Luxury
Author: By Fawnia Soo Hoo
Content: Set on the picturesque island of Koh Samui, the third season of The White Lotus delivers plenty of immersive vacation porn as well as enviably audacious designer wardrobes on a new slate of badly behaving guests. “We don’t do quiet luxury,” says returning costume designer Alex Bovaird, who received two out of her three Emmy nominations for the first two seasons of the Mike White series. As a fresh set of potential Blossom Circle members take in the stunning views from the private boat to the resort, Raleigh, North Carolina, matriarch Victoria Ratliff (Parker Posey), tightly clutching her Gucci 1947 bamboo top-handle bag, turns down her nose at fellow guests—and the entire Thailand experience. With a bright blue silk scarf by Swaine London primly tied over the shoulders of her preppy Banana Republic shirtdress, Victoria wishes she was in England—or anywhere in western Europe—with her three children and sketchy financier husband Timothy (Jason Isaacs). “My inspiration for [the Ratliffs] was as if they just stepped out of a Ralph Lauren catalog,” says Bovaird. But Victoria did pack a suitcase, presumably checked first-class, of “loud Lilly Pulitzer”–esque dresses and floaty cover-ups, perfect for sipping mint juleps by a members-only pool. Bovaird referenced how the society set in Oxford, Mississippi, dress and the lifestyle of “the caftan queen of Birmingham, Alabama,” Susan Dumas. “She and her country club friends love vintage caftans,” says Bovaird, who also designed a resort-ready White Lotus–inspired collaboration with H&M. The eldest Ratliff sibling, Saxon (Patrick Schwarzenegger), thirsty for his withholding father’s approval, immediately telegraphs douchebag bro in one of his many Southern Tide polo shirts, wraparound Roger Federer sunglasses, and Gucci loafers sans socks. “His shorts are Brooks Brothers, and they’re just not the cool length,” says Bovaird. Younger sister Piper (Sarah Catherine Hook), who’s seeking spirituality on the island, hints at the burgeoning disconnect from her family with her ’80s-referential Ralph Lauren white lace dress. “She is a little bit more of the pure voice who’s looking for something more meaningful than her very materialistic family,” says Bovaird, who referenced a teenage Brooke Shields for Piper’s demure embroidered and lace-trimmed dresses. “[She’s] a bit more earthy, really wholesome, and a little more covered up.” Off to the side, a trio of 40-something childhood best friends giggle and gossip at the start of their decadent, and potentially debauched, reunion trip. In their coordinating sundresses, bags, and blonde highlights, they could be a girl group: TV actor Jaclyn (Michelle Monaghan) in Alemais and Valentino; Austin socialite Kate (Leslie Bibb) in Paul Smith and Delvaux; and New York City lawyer Laurie (Carrie Coon) in Zimmermann and Loewe—check, check, and check. “They’re supposed to look interchangeable, but Laurie is the one who’s maybe trying to keep up with the girls,” says Bovaird. For the first-night dinner, Laurie dons a vintage Sue Wong watercolor-print jumpsuit, and later cries into her Giambattista Valli chain-link bag. Meanwhile, Kate, in red ruffle-tiered Lanvin, and Jaclyn, in a gold dragon-embroidered ’70s black vintage dress, trade fake, backhanded compliments. Jaclyn also employs her holiday as an opportunity for designer spon-con. “We imagined that she got a box of resort pieces that Valentino sent over. Maybe Kate grabbed a suit out of Jaclyn’s box,” says Bovaird. “Because that’s true to life—brands want to support actors.” For their first trip to the pool, Kate wraps a black-and-white panther-print sarong from the 2023 Escape collection around the waist of a Valentino hot pink maillot. Jaclyn, who’s regularly recognized by guests, appropriately called dibs on the showier, logo-mania pieces, like an oversized shirt cover-up and a flashy silver-sequined minidress. But odd couple Chelsea (Aimee Lou Wood) and older boyfriend Rick (Walton Goggins) don’t quite fit in with the designer label–stacked façade of their fellow guests. “You’re supposed to bump up against them and think, Who are these two grifters? Because they are a little bit less put-together,” says Bovaird. “They seem like a couple of rogues. You’re just supposed to wonder what their story is, and they’re supposed to have a crackling sexual chemistry.” A grizzled Rick broods and smolders in a steady rotation of slouchy, halfway unbuttoned Hawaiian shirts, giving off the aura of an American expat with a questionable livelihood but deep pockets. Free-spirited Mancunian Chelsea takes selfies in a cutout My Beachy Side minidress. “She has this louche, sexy, Brigitte Bardot [vibe],” says Bovaird. “She’s been traveling for several years. We imagined she got the crochet dress from a market, or she collected things from Goa. She’s supposed to have this very market-driven, eclectic wardrobe.” Chelsea effortlessly mixes vintage with market-bought sarongs and minidresses, but her colorful bikinis are mostly by Corsica-based Tara Matthews. Chelsea also pairs a parrot-print vintage-looking Loewe wrap skirt with a throwback Blondie T-shirt, and carries JW Anderson and Louis Vuitton bags. “She has lots of sunglasses that she ‘got down at the market,’ but are actually by Jacquemus,” says Bovaird. Jacquemus also custom-designed two full looks for model Chloe (Charlotte LeBon), who a lonely Chelsea meets at the resort bar. (Keep an eye on Chloe’s “LBH”—“losers back home”—boyfriend, Gary, played by Jon Gries, who can’t seem to resist the nearest White Lotus location.) “[Jacquemus] designed special pieces just for The White Lotus in Thailand and hand-delivered them to Koh Samui,” says Bovaird about Chloe’s black-and-white polka-dotted bodysuit and striped, sequined skirt outfit that Chelsea admires, and a pink one-piece and sheer sarong for a yacht party. The White Lotus Maui spa manager Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) threads all three seasons of the slow-burn series together, as she spends a month at the Koh Samui outpost for a work-share session. She enjoys hands-on massage sessions with her very fit Thai counterpart, Pornchai (Dom Hetrakul)—and a resort wardrobe filled with colorful, tropical-print dresses and caftans from brands like Anthropologie and Verandah. “Belinda is a little self-conscious that she’s there on her work trip,” says Bovaird, who also custom-made looks with vibrant Thai fabrics for the character. “When she’s out of her uniform, she wants to feel as good as the guests.” Speaking of, what was it like putting Lalisa Manoban, aka Lisa of Blackpink, in a uniform to play resort staffer Mook? “I think it was refreshing for her not to worry too much about the bits and baubles, and making sure everything was super-fashionable,” says Bovaird. With the help of a local Thai crew, and input from Manoban, Bovaird custom-designed Mook’s blouse-and-sarong uniform. But the staffer first greets the guests in a cute palm-tree-and-monkey-embroidered short-sleeve shirt-and-shorts set that’s by Tombolo. “This season, we definitely upped our game,” says Bovaird. “We definitely had the right shoe for the right swimsuits, cover-ups, hats, bags, and sunglasses. Whereas, in season one, we were like, ‘Here are your flip-flops.’” Jennifer Lawrence Adds Dad Shoes to Her Maternity Wardrobe Why Does Everyone Have a Belted Bag Now? Title: Dakota Johnson Puts Her Own Twist on the Safety Pin Dress With a Sexy Slit
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: It’s been a while since we’ve had a show-stopping dress slit. Purveyors of the classic and sexy red carpet look range from Angelina Jolie to Miley Cyrus—another lover of the leggy affair? Dakota Johnson. And this time, the actor went from thigh-high to hip-kissing. Johnson stepped out on the red carpet for Saturday Night Live’s 50th anniversary special at 30 Rockerfeller Center on Sunday evening (February 16)—a starry event celebrating the pop culture behemoth, with attendees including Vogue cover star Sabrina Carpenter, Kim Kardashian, Miley Cyrus, Emma Stone, and Bad Bunny. The Madame Web actor wore a black, one-sleeved Gucci gown fastened with delicate gold hardware and a bodysuit underneath, allowing the brave slit to travel up to her hips. She also wore black open-toed stilettos and minimal jewelry, with a sweep of eyebrow-skimming bangs and her brunette hair long and straight. The delicate gold chains holding Johnson’s Gucci dress together recalled another sensual and daring red carpet look: the safety pin dress, which through the years, has been worn by Anne Hathaway, Miley Cyrus, Kristen Stewart, and of course the vivacious original, Elizabeth Hurley in Versace. Johnson’s own interpretation is stoically sensual. It was a stylish weekend of events celebrating Saturday Night Live’ 50th year, that ran the gamut of true Hollywood glam and campy looks. Emma Stone filled her custom Louis Vuitton gown pockets with popcorn and toted a cinema snack box in lieu of a bag, while Miley Cyrus donned two Roberto Cavalli looks—one recent runway, one archival—for a gothic showgirl performance. For her own stage-time to do the ever-iconic “D*ck in a Box” song, Lady Gaga wore a black velvet gown with a zany-patterned gift box attached to her waist. Glamor, intrigue, sex—a stellar sartorial tribute to SNL. Johnson is no stranger to skin-forward gowns, and it’s usually Gucci that’s her go-to: sheer, silvered, shimmering. But what Dakota Johnson surely proves here is that sometimes, your legs are your best accessory. Jennifer Lawrence Adds Dad Shoes to Her Maternity Wardrobe Why Does Everyone Have a Belted Bag Now? Title: Emma Stone Takes the ‘Popcorn Actress’ Label Literally
Author: By Anna Cafolla
Content: One of those best things about going out to see a show? The theater snacks. Maybe a box of nachos or a little cup of ice-cream to see you through the evening—but Emma Stone is all about the popcorn. And she made sure she had enough to hand at SNL50: The Anniversary Special in New York City, by wearing her own cinema snacks on her hips. The actor stepped onto the red carpet with partner and former SNL writer Dave McCary sporting a custom Louis Vuitton, cinema seat red, halterneck dress. The dress had two pockets that were heaping with popcorn. The rest of Stone’s look was simple: Louis Vuitton red heels, gold star-shaped earrings, and in lieu of a bag, a candy-striped popcorn box filled with more popcorn that she of course helped herself to. Stone wore her hair in her latest pixie cut. This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. It was also a special sort of date night for Stone and McCary ,who first met in 2016, when Stone, who hosted SNL in December that same year, starred in a sketch directed by McCary, “Wells for Boys.” Stone is also one of only a few five-time SNL hosts (and remains the youngest to have ever done so) including Steve Martin and Tom Hanks. It’s also not the first time popcorn has been part of the 2025 entertainment industry chatter. Rewind, to Demi Moore’s speech at the 2025 Golden Globes ,when she won best actress for The Substance. It marked the first major industry award in the 62-year-old actor’s 45-year career, and in her moving acceptance speech, she acknowledged the stereotypes she has faced for having starred in films primed for entertainment value and box-office earnings over critical reception or contributions to cinema discourse—defying the ‘popcorn actress’ label. And as the weekend of SNL celebrations continued and we reflected on the mammoth show’s impact on pop culture, the moniker feels even more foolish. Stone’s snackable style was by longtime stylist Petra Flannery, whose other client Zoe Saldaña took home best supporting actress for Emilia Perez at the BAFTAs on the same evening. Less campy than Stone but still big on the drama, Zoe Saldaña wore a pleated collar Yves Saint Laurent gown. We could maybe just about get away with likening Stone’s popcorn-filled pockets to the structured hips and peplum silhouetted gowns that are more in keeping with her usual red carpet style: like her eggshell colored 2024 Oscars gown, or her red shelf-hipped 2025 Golden Globes dress—both also by Louis Vuitton. Popcorn pockets or whimsy peplums, Stone tends to lean into classic Hollywood glamor and elegant gowns. Her last red carpet surprise was all about her newly done pixie cut—which she’s likely cut for Bugonia, her latest film with Yorgos Lanthimos and which is set to debut in 2025. Stone’s SNL50 dress went down well with fellow attendees—Seth Rogan even got a couple of handfuls. Feeling peckish? Emma Stone’s got you. But one question that remains: was it sweet or salted, buttered or toffee? More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Blake Lively Brings Her Love of Florals to SNL’s 50th Anniversary Special
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: Tonight, the Saturday Night Live 50th Anniversary Special airs on NBC—celebrating five decades of the hit sketch comedy show, with a slew of celebrity guest cameos. The red carpet premiere in New York City was extremely star studded: Kim Kardashian, Bad Bunny, Meryl Streep, Anya Taylor-Joy, and more all hit the step and repeat. One high-profile duo in the mix? Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds, who attended the occasion in their finest formal attire. Lively opted for her signature red carpet look for the night: a glitzy floral-covered dress. (Fans of the star will recall she wore floral designs nonstop throughout her It Ends With Us press tour, as a nod to her character in the film, who is a florist.) Lively’s latest SNL look consisted of a silver Tamara Ralph sequin-covered gown, complete with floral embellishments throughout. For a more monochromatic finish, she accessorized with diamonds and strappy metallic hells. Reynolds, meanwhile, wore a classic black tuxedo, white dress shirt, and a bowtie. Tonight marked one of Lively’s first major public appearances since reports of a legal battle between her and her It Ends With Us co-star Justin Baldoni emerged—a dispute which remains ongoing. Title: Inside the Stylish Weekend Celebrating Saturday Night Live’s 50th Anniversary
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: Saturday Night Live is marking a major milestone: This weekend, the iconic sketch comedy show from creator Lorne Michaels is celebrating its 50th anniversary with a slew of events in New York City. The festivities kicked off on Friday evening, with the SNL50: The Homecoming Concert at Radio City Music Hall. Naturally, the red carpet was a star-studded affair. Given SNL has welcomed hundreds of A-list hosts and musical guests over the years (it’s hard to think of a big star who hasn’t made a cameo on the show), it was only fitting that many celebrities joined the fun. Among those who walked the step and repeat on Friday were Miley Cyrus, Chris Pine, Christine Baranski—each one of them bringing some good, old-fashioned glitz and glamour to the party. Inside the historic venue, Lady Gaga performed “Shallow” with Andy Samberg, and did a funny bit to botch the song, before performing “Dick in a Box”—their 2009 SNL parody banger. Gaga, in a velvet black dress, stood with a zany giftbox taped to her waist—three guesses as to what they’re insinuating is inside. Miley Cyrus took to the stage in her gothic showgirl glory to perform “Flowers”, do a cover of Queen’s “Crazy Little Thing Called Love” with Brittany Howard, and shout that she loves Paul Rudd. Cher also performed “If I Could Turn Back Time,” well as Bad Bunny, Post Malone, The Backstreet Boys, The B-52’s, and Will Ferrell and Ana Gasteyer (who did their own hilarious versions of songs like Doechii’s “Denial is a River.” The celebrations continued on Sunday night, with the official SNL50: The Anniversary Special airing on NBC. Another step and repeat premiere was held for the release—and even more celebrities came out for the viewing party. Below, see all of the stars at SNL’s 50th-anniversary kickoff and how things went down inside. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: The Best Dressed Stars From the 2025 BAFTAs
Author: By Christian Allaire
Content: This evening in London, the 2025 BAFTAs marked the latest celebration of some of the last year’s best film and television projects—among them Wicked, Emilia Pérez, Anora, and Conclave. As such, the red carpet saw a bevy of A-list stars turn out for the affair (many of whom are also nominated for Academy Awards in March). The best dressed stars of the night? Those who leaned into New Hollywood glamour (yes, you read that right), choosing sculptural silhouettes and modernized finishes that felt fresh. Take Wicked star Cynthia Erivo, who went ethereal in her white macramé cotton lace bustier gown (with a breastplate that defied gravity—get it?). In McQueen, Demi Moore also turned heads in a dazzling gown that was reminiscent of stained glass, while Emilia Pérez star Selena Gomez chose a long, sleeveless gown by Schiaparelli Couture embroidered with silver sequins, crystals, rhinestones, and tassels—talk about disco ball dressing at its finest. As for some of the best dressed gents of the night? Colman Domingo reworked traditional suiting in a printed shirt and leather coat by Versace. Timothée Chalamet went sleek in all black Bottega Veneta—a refreshing switch-up from the bolder, more Y2K-leaning looks he has been wearing while promoting A Complete Unknown. (And isn’t that the making of a true fashion star—keeping us on our toes?) Below, see the best dressed stars from the 2025 BAFTAs. Is this your favorite look? Is this your favorite look? Title: Timothée Chalamet and Kylie Jenner Do Matching Couple Style at the BAFTAs
Author: By Olivia Allen
Content: With the 2025 BAFTAs in full swing, Timothée Chalamet has once again got us talking. Fresh off the A Complete Unknown press tour–zipping around on a Lime bike in Martine Rose and fully leaning into his Bob Dylan era—his latest look continues the streak. Over the weekend, he made waves at the Berlin Film Festival, out in Kendrick-inspired bootcut jeans and accompanying Kylie Jenner in a pink Chrome Hearts tracksuit—a stark contrast against his girlfriend’s glittering gown. For tonight’s red carpet, though, Timmy went for something a bit more classic. The best-actor nominee wore a double-breasted, all-black ensemble by Bottega Veneta—proving that sometimes simplicity really is best. It was a departure from his laidback athleisure looks this week, but felt like exactly the right choice for his moment in the limelight. While Jenner skipped the step and repeat (as she did at the Golden Globes and in Berlin), the beauty mogul was spotted inside the ceremony wearing a black embellished slip dress—perfectly matching Timothée’s sleek red carpet look. Title: Cynthia Erivo’s Louis Vuitton Breastplate Defies Gravity at the 2025 BAFTAs
Author: By Olivia Allen
Content: Cynthia Erivo knows how to make an entrance, and she did just that at the 2025 BAFTAs tonight. In a white lace-embroidered Louis Vuitton gown, the Wicked star delivered a sculptural look that solidified her reputation for bold, red-carpet winning fashion. With its sharp architectural design, the dress was a statement that held space (get it?) from head to toe. While Erivo delivered a series of Elphaba-green looks during the Wicked press tour, the British actor has shifted towards a more monochrome colour palette during awards season—from the black-and-white floral gown she wore at the Golden Globes (also by Louis Vuitton) to the black sequined Armani Privè gown she wore at the Critics Choice Awards. Nominated for Best Actress at this year’s BAFTAs, Erivo’s transition from Broadway to film has been the stuff of legends—with three Oscars nominations under her belt, she’s solidified her place among Hollywood’s elite. As she gears up to co-host Vogue’s Fashion & Film party, it’s clear that Erivo is an unstoppable force both on screen and off. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: Why Demi Moore’s Custom McQueen Gown at the 2025 BAFTAs Was a Perfect Choice
Author: By Kerry McDermott
Content: Creative director Seán McGirr recently told British Vogue that he wants his Alexander McQueen to be about youthful energy and “the animal within.” Which makes the Irish designer’s work a particularly apposite choice for Demi Moore, star of The Substance, in which a younger version of her character, Elisabeth Sparkle, literally bursts forth from her flesh in scenes gorier than any wildlife documentary. Moore, who is in the running for the Leading Actress BAFTA for her performance in the film, arrived at the 2025 ceremony tonight wearing a glittering halter-neck gown, featuring a graphic design. Evidently a fan of McGirr’s work, the star previously wore a shimmering black gown from his spring 2025 Alexander McQueen collection on the red carpet back in November. Demi has emerged as the toast of awards season, having already scooped a Golden Globe last month, her first major win (indeed her first nomination, as she noted in her acceptance speech) in some 45 years in the movie business. An emotional Moore, who described how she’d gotten used to being written off as a “popcorn actress” despite having one of the most enduring careers in Hollywood, told the crowd on the night that she was celebrating “being reminded that I do belong.” If she’s had to wait a while for recognition from her peers, Demi, who collected that Golden Globe in a shimmering strapless Armani Privé gown, has never been short of fashion plaudits. While she was crafting her own looks for her earliest red carpet appearances, at 62 she’s a regular on the front row (frequently accompanied by her almost equally feted pet dog, Pilaf), and she’s been known to appear on the runway, too. When Kim Jones was preparing to unveil his debut Fendi Haute Couture collection at the Palais Brongniart back in 2021, he cast supermodels Kate Moss, Christy Turlington and Naomi Campbell, but it was Demi he tasked with opening the show. Title: Mikey Madison’s Custom Prada Gown at the 2025 BAFTAs Confirms She’s Fashion’s Newest Star
Author: By Emily Chan
Content: Since emerging on the scene in breakout hit Anora, Mikey Madison has quickly established herself as a fashion girlie—from the vintage lace Dior gown that she and stylist Jamie Mizrahi picked out for the British Independent Film Awards, to the gold sequined Bottega Veneta gown that she wore to the Golden Globes, which came with the added clout of being creative director Matthieu Blazy’s last custom look for the brand. As is often a rite of passage for a buzzy emerging actor, Madison seems to have found a particular affinity, though, with Miuccia Prada’s creations: see the custom red off-shoulder gown that she wore to the Governors Awards, the crystal-embellished black velvet dress she sported at the London Film Festival, or the blush-pink old Hollywood style Miu Miu gown she opted for at the Palm Springs Film Festival. It’s perhaps no surprise, then, that Madison went for another custom Prada look at tonight’s BAFTAs: a white bustier dress with an embellished crystal scarf that delivered old-school Hollywood glamour, firmly establishing her role as one of fashion’s (and Hollywood’s) brightest new stars. It’s a busy night for Madison, who is not only up for Best Leading Actress at tonight’s awards ceremony, but also co-hosting British Vogue & GQ’s Fashion & Film Party. Come back to see what dazzling look she serves up for the afters. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved. Title: BAFTAs 2025: See Every Look From the Red Carpet
Author: By Vogue
Content: The 2025 BAFTAs are here: the annual star-studded celebration that sees the best creative minds in British film, and beyond, come together for one night only. It’s a fun one this year, too, with the likes of Demi Moore, Cynthia Erivo, and Mikey Madison nominated for Best Actress (the latter two also happen to be co-hosts for British Vogue & GQ’s Fashion & Film after-party), while Timothée Chalamet is nominated alongside Adrien Brody and Hugh Grant in the Best Actor race. Not only that, but pop-songstresses-turned-Hollywood-stars Selena Gomez and Ariana Grande are both up for Best Supporting Actress, while Succession co-stars Jeremy Strong and Kieran Culkin have received nods in the Best Supporting Actor category. Meanwhile, Irish hip-hop trio Kneecap has picked up nominations in six categories, including Outstanding British Film category, alongside queer crime thriller Love Lies Bleeding. Oh, and Take That are performing! A song from 2008! See, we told you this was a fun one. But now for the important bit: the red-carpet looks. Obviously all award shows are basically just an excuse for everyone to get dressed up and party, and the BAFTAs—which is taking place at the Southbank Centre’s Royal Festival Hall again this year—is no different. Below, see all the best looks from the 2025 BAFTAs red carpet. More from Vogue See More Stories © 2025 Condé Nast. All rights reserved.
